alert.note: Alert for McDonald (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 3:50AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following county, McDonald. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 350 AM CST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Big Sugar Creek at Buzzard Glory Road, Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road and Bentonville Hollow at Highway E. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pineville and Powell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
